question_text: Select two key differences between DDR3 and DDR5 memory technologies.
answer_options: DDR5 provides higher data transfer rates
DDR5 is backward compatible with DDR3
DDR3 operates at a lower voltage than DDR5
DDR5 includes improvements in memory channel architecture
correct_answer: DDR5 provides higher data transfer rates
DDR5 includes improvements in memory channel architecture
explanation: DDR5 improves data throughput and memory efficiency with architectural changes, but it is not backward compatible and typically runs at lower voltages than DDR3.
